Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is thickly caked with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and the remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393303) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393303)
